data.title: Hotloading of tool mode is broken
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 5
Godot 2.2 custom build

**Issue description:**
Adding "tool" keyword to a script to enable it in the editor causes multiple errors in the console.
If you close Godot editor and restart it, tool mode does work directly.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Clone the project below (https://github.com/StraToN/campaines-fish.git)
Open scenes/3D/wandering_fishes.tscn.
Select a `fish*` node and edit the script (fish_realistic.gd)
Add the tool keyword on top. Save.
The console prints errors non-stop.
Remove the "tool" keyword. Save. 
The console stops printing errors as tool mode is disabled.
Re-add the "tool" keyword. Save. 
Restart Godot.
Reopen the scene.
Tool mode is enabled and working good.


**Link to minimal example project:**
https://github.com/StraToN/campaines-fish.git
Use the wandering_fishes.tscn scene located in scenes/3D

data.title: Need options for bounding boxes in Editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
arch + ubuntu

**Issue description:**
Having many hidden objects in the scene, all the bounding boxes are visible.
Would be good to have the following options:
Dont display bounding boxes
Display bounding box only on selected objects
Display bounding box on visible objects
Display all bounding boxes

![bounding_box](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/650506/26233446/9994ced2-3c9c-11e7-8195-0faf8072d7fd.jpg)

data.title: Fix android payment logical error
data.body:
getting sku detail runs only if mod != 0 which means querying 20*n will not get sku details.
referenced from https://github.com/googlesamples/android-play-billing/blob/master/TrivialDrive/app/src/main/java/com/example/android/trivialdrivesample/util/IabHelper.java#L1029-L1062

data.title: Detect newer Visual Studio compilers correctly like VS2017.
data.body:
Currently the compiler isn't detected correctly and will default always to an x86 build.
This should correct this for newer compilers.

data.title: Finish implementing GDnative builtins bindings
data.body:
Heavy PR:
- Finish implementing the missing apis
- Clean the existing ones to keep the same consistency

PS: I've generated this code with a custom script which parses `core/variant_call.cpp`, so it is pretty simple for me to change multiple signatures/bodies if needed by the review ;-)

data.title: Export nested nodes in TileSet scenes; resolves #8819.
data.body:
Adds _import_node() that, when used in conjunction with _import_scene, recurses through the scene tree and exports all available nodes.

*Important note:* This is not tested with nested sprites, although it should work. More eyes on this are gladly welcome.

data.title: TileSet Exporter does not export nested sprites
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Arch Linux; Godot 2.1.3 official

**Issue description:**

When converting a TileSet scene into a TileSet resource, the exporter requires the sprites to be top-level or one child down. For example, if you had a scene with the hierarchy:

```
+ root
|
+-+ dirt
| +- dirt-center
| +- dirt-top
| +- dirt-bottom
|
+-+ grass
| +- grass-1
| +- grass-2
|
+-+ nuclear-barrel
```

the TileSet exporter would export only `dirt-center`, `grass-`, and `nuclear-barrel`. This is because of the non-recursive nature of the parser.

#5816 is potentially related.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Create a new TileSet scene.
2. Create a hierarchy of nodes.
3. Scene > Convert To > TileSet
4. Most of the nested tiles are missing.

The fix for this should be pretty simple. I'm working on one right now, and if it works properly, I'll submit a PR soon.

data.title: GDScript bindings for various missing Mesh functions.
data.body: Fixes #8041.

data.title: Strange effect with shadows enabled on DirectionalLight
data.body:
**Godot version: master 32afcbc48 but more recent too**

**Issue description:**
Using default settings, when turning shadows `on` on a DirectionalLight, the editor get some weird effect on textures.
Camera viewport get less noisy output and the running camera even less, but is still there.

![shadowbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/26223544/f228777c-3bf4-11e7-8e70-736e57facf8c.png)


I think the effect is not present on OmniLight and just at some extent on SpotLight (faces parallel to the light direction). 
This may be a bad default setting issue, but not sure.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add a directional light to a 3D scene and enable shadows. 

**Link to minimal example project:**


[shadowtest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1012427/shadowtest.zip)

data.title: Window dialog title bar's background are not visible on default theme
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04 - Godot version: master ed6baffc7**


**Issue description:**
Title bars of window dialogs have a not visible/transparent background (affects editor and respective controls with default theme). 

This is how the project manager looks:
![transparent-title](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/26217767/f41be67e-3bde-11e7-929d-36cf959a9116.png)

I think this is a known theme issue but I have not seen it anywhere else.

data.title: Particle shadows work only with directional light
data.body:
**Godot version: master ed6baffc7 **


**Issue description:**
Particle shadows from omni and spot lights are updated only once (in editor and maybe running, hard to tell), they work fine with directional light. 

![particleshadows](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/26214760/f196219a-3bd3-11e7-8254-efad13247167.png)



**Steps to reproduce:**
Create an omni and/or spotlight that makes particles to projects shadows.
Do the same with a directional light.



**Link to minimal example project:**
[particleshadow.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1011715/particleshadow.zip)

data.title: Cannot add icons to a module without forking Godot
data.body:
As a continuation to #4562, AFAIK it's not possible to include custom icons to a module, because they are stored in a separate folder `tools/editor/icons` which is part of the core editor.
It would be great to be able to define icons in modules to make them more independent and easy to install.
This makes me think that, any resource that we bundle in the editor could be added to modules this way instead of a global folder.

data.title: OmniLight can produce weird shadows when close to objects
data.body:
**Godot version: master ed6baffc7**


**Issue description:**
OmniLight can produce (cool) weird shadows:
![omnibug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/26213577/fc331be8-3bcf-11e7-83ac-70f6315195c9.png)

I refer to the cat eye shaped figure in the shadows, happens with both light modes, cube and dual paraboloid.
My almost null knowledge on 3D scenes may be a problem here too, these are using default settings.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Just put an OmniLight over a cube close to the object.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[omnishadow.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1011639/omnishadow.zip)

EDIT:
Rotating the shadow gives a more impressive effect:
![rotatedomnibuggedshadow](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/26214027/5cf75e52-3bd1-11e7-8cd9-d3e6756b216b.png)

data.title: Duplication of tiles is broken in Gridmap
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
linux mint 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
I try to use gridmap for a simple project and I find out that when duplicating the area, the way to place the duplicated part is not good, from the image, you can see that I have to point my cursor to somewhere far away to move the target near the original area. I assume this is due to how the origin is set in gridmap? is it better to let the cursor stick to the middle of the duplicated part? 
![2017-05-18 23 06 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10883749/26209301/fa6276f2-3c1e-11e7-9b40-781a70153268.png)

data.title: [TRACKER] Collision Shape issues for 3.0
data.body:
This issue tracks improvements, bugs and compatibility breaks related with Collision Shapes and Godot 3.0

- [ ] Rigidbodies in linked scenes use linked collision shapes, even if the collision shape is changed in the parent scene #9105
- [ ] Instanced CollisionPolygon2D's cannot perform collision detection #8896
- [ ] CollisionShapes cannot be rotated #8153 
- [ ] Collision shapes overridden in inherited scenes are not used by physics, but display fine. #8103
- [x] Godot 3.0 Collisions Shapes (CollisionShape2D / CollisionPolygon2D) dont get drawn on the editor or debug, except RectangleShape2D, RayShape2D or LineShape2D #8033
- [ ] Collision with edges between convex/planar face pair #7701
- [ ] Collision shapes persist after they've been deleted #7693
- [ ] Poor optimizations in the physics engine #7690
- [ ] Shape2D added to CollisionObject2D do not appear with Visual Collision enabled. #7281
- [ ] Buggy collision detection when ConvexPolygonShape2D is given a concave polygon with set_points() #8611
- [ ] Collision shapes are drawn in wrong color and collision contact points are not drawn at all #8607
- [ ] Add one-way collision to tile-set/tile-map (2.1) #8558
- [ ] Convex collision shapes + kinematic body + look_at + move = cpu catches fire #8750 (unconfirmed)
- [ ] Bad collision against StaticBody2D with LineShape2D #7920
- [ ] CollisionShape2D trigger doesn't behave as expected #4393
- [ ] Collision shape gizmo isn't updated upon changing the shape #8910
- [ ] Error 3D physics, violation collision mesh RigidBody and other body #4831
- [ ] User imported 3D Collision Shapes only interact with primitives and not each other #4591
- [ ] Physic Body Instanced scene doesn't use CollisionShapes #2314
- [ ] CollisionShape2D does not exist at run-time after reparent/duplication #1183

**Improvements / Suggestions**

- [ ] "Collision Groups" handling Collision Layers & Masks #7793
- [ ] Expose collision resolution bias in editor for rigid bodies/collision shapes #7700
- [ ] Scaled RigidBody should show a node warning in the scene tree as it's something that should not be done #7615
- [ ] Attaching CollisionShapes to bones #8318
- [ ] Shape Colision Editor Suggestions #8227

data.title: [TRACKER] Editor theme issues for 3.0
data.body:
This tracker bug is for all issues related to the new editor theme for Godot 3.0.

## PRs

- [x] New customizable editor theme #8631

## Bugs

- [x] Window dialog title bar's background are not visible on default theme #8816
- [x] New Theme: Tree drag&drop visual helper is barely visible. #8677
- [x] Script heat colors are not adjusted to new theme (they blend with background) #8608

## Enhancements

- [x] Changing the remote debugging icon #8480
- [x] Scan file selection font color broken #8635
- [x] HTML5 icon needs update #8836
- [x] Make scroll bars look different when pressed #8875
- [x] Editor Theme font color based on theme color #8893

data.title: SSAO needs blur amount slider
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
ubuntu + arch

**Issue description:**
SSAO needs a blur amound slider. Currently its a fixed value blur.
Also would be good to have intensity values higher than the limit of 9 currently imposed...

data.title: Make MessageQueue::flush() reentrant (2.1)
data.body:
Given that the message queue can be flushed potentially during an outer flush (that is, reentrantly), this function needs to be reentrant.

Currently it's only done for a hack involving input handling (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blame/21bf3778d5c291e1587cddb154a5cc0e02b0aecc/scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp#L432 and https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blame/21bf3778d5c291e1587cddb154a5cc0e02b0aecc/scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp#L453).

**And that is a source of headache bugs, because it can make you get duplicated signals, deferred calls, etc. And only depending on whether an input event is produced.**

But in the future who knows where else that may happen.

data.title: Make MessageQueue::flush() reentrant
data.body:
Given that the message queue can be flushed potentially during an outer flush (that is, reentrantly), this function needs to be reentrant.

Currently it's only done for a hack involving input handling (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blame/683befbf8474d2a1875227727b818ac90c754d2f/scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp#L480 and https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blame/683befbf8474d2a1875227727b818ac90c754d2f/scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp#L501-L501).

**And that is a source of headache bugs, because it can make you get duplicated signals, deferred calls, etc. And only depending on whether an input event is produced.**

But in the future who knows where else that may happen.

data.title: [TRACKER] Main bugs to fix before first official 3.0-alpha build
data.body:
This tracker issue is meant to list the main bugs that should be handled in priority before we can release a public alpha build.

That alpha build is not meant to be bug free, but these objectives should be met:
- The renderer should *work* (at least run, not all features need to be perfect) on most hardware supporting OpenGL 3.3 (desktop).
- OSX, Windows and X11 platforms should compile and run. It's OK for the first alpha if the other platforms don't work yet.
- The editor should be usable, i.e. the basic features should work as expected. The new theme should be polished for a better usability, as it currently has many outstanding usability regressions.
- Rendering features advertised in the progress reports should work. They don't have to be perfect, but they should be usable so that testers can start seeing how the 3.0 will be like (and give feedback to improve it).
- The various outstanding bugs linked to compatibility breakage should be fixed or at least mitigated.
- C# integration is not a requirement for that build. If it's ready, that's great, but it's not a blocker.
- The rendering features planned for 3.0 and not implemented yet can be left for *after* that first build. There are enough outstanding issues to fix before adding new ones.

------

## High priority bugs

- [ ] Asset Library should be able to filter plugins by compatibility with engine version #7147
- [x] Removing a rigidbody and re-adding it to the scene results in errors and the rigidbody disappearing #10074
- [ ] Graphic artifacts in 3d scenes. #10149
- [x] Glow post effect is broken for softlight and screen blend modes (regression from 5567e89) #9106
- [x] Font hinting causing chunky fonts #9441
- [x] Godot freeze computer, when shadow contact set to 1 #9740
- [x] Glow seems to be broken (regression from 772485c) #9797 
- [x] Refraction is broken (regression from 772485c) #9803

------

*Edit:* Previous list, archived on 24 July.

**High priority bugs**

- [x] InputEvent's is_action{,_pressed,_released} don't work #8914 
- [x] Keyboard in editor unusable in latest code #8894
- [x] Image -> *.stex conversion is broken since it was made a Resource. #8801
- [x] Names of ClassDB-bound methods changed #8742
- [ ] OBJ files and DAE (better dae) are not imported correctly. Absent in .import folder. #8741
- [x] Broken lighting on Collada mesh with normal map [Intel HD 3000] #8711
- [ ] SSAO graphical issue with glitchy lines #8708
- [x] Using a texture in 3D always forces a re-import and makes it darker. #8684 
- [x] Various undefined shader problems #8681
- [x] Color degradation with directional shadow #8683
- [x] Normal maps in skinned/rigged meshes fail to work correctly #8673
- [x] Massive lag and OpenGL error spam on Windows with Intel graphics #8665 
- [x] Issues with the "View" menu in 3D mode #8489
- [x] Crash on AudioPlayer save scene #8596
- [x] color picker doesn't display colors properly #8372
- [x] The editor viewport with wrong size #8328
- [x] Crash making new shader in editor #8314
- [x] GI probes don't seem to have an effect #8194
- [x] Can apply CanvasItemMaterial to 3D Nodes #8121
- [x] Screen-space reflections issues #8119
- [x] Crash when opening default lighting config dialog #8082
- [x] TIME breaks canvas_item shaders #9123
- [x] Adding uniform sampler2D on shader_type canvas_item, brakes and forceclose godot #9143
- [x] Texture import freezes #9183

**Nice to fix** // can be for next alpha

- [x] Path editor plugin not working #8886
- [x] Strange effect with shadows enabled on DirectionalLight #8817
- [x] Particle shadows work only with directional light #8815
- [x] OmniLight can produce weird shadows when close to objects #8813
- [x] Accessing transform matrices data in shader breaks it. #8751
- [x] Varying in shader is not working #8749
- [x] Using INDEX on a particles shader, breaks the shader #8731
- [x] Viewport transparent background doesnt work #8703
- [x] Spotlights with shadows enabled cast light between mesh faces #8654
- [x] Collision shapes are drawn in wrong color and collision contact points are not drawn at all #8607
- [x] Light2D with shadows enabled near an occluder displays errors instead of shadows #8560
- [x] Glow affects gizmos #8485 
- [x] Object bounding boxes are always zero #8446
- [x] Thumbnails not visible in filesystem dock #8377
- [x] Only the first sampler showing up in ShaderMaterial Shader Param list #8353
- [x] SSAO doesn't play well with smooth shading #8237
- [x] Gizmos lose their colors #8118
- [x] Some 2D nodes aren't visible: canvas_item_add_triangle_array() doesn't work #7840 
- [x] FileSystem thumbnails display 2D scene (impressive bug!) #7812
- [x] Collision shapes and polygons not getting drawn on 2D #8033 (*bojidar-bg*)

data.title: Impossible to import font with path containing accented characters
data.body:
Happened on Windows 7, Godot 2.1.3 (stable)

Couldn't import a font with a path containing accented characters (folder or the font name itself). Preview did not work and the window poped a "Couldn't save font." message when I tried to import the font.

Everything worked fine when I moved the font elsewhere, where it would not have a path with accented characters.

data.title: Allow update/import of assets without opening editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
ubuntu + arch

**Issue description:**
It would be extremely handy and time saving to have a way to check for updated assets before loading the game, or even during the game.
Such as a commandline argument.
This would save having to open the editor just to update the textures/meshes etc.
Having blender open, the editor and the game, gets tedious switching back and forth between them all.

data.title: Localization List Alphabetized
data.body:
Is there any way we can get the language list in localization remapping alphabetized?  Currently it seems to be a very long list of randomly listed languages.  It would be easier to navigate in order.

Alternatively, and probably more complicated, show only the languages used in the other translation tab.  Though not sure how feasible that is.

data.title: Image -> *.stex conversion is broken since it was made a Resource.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
linux, tip 787dad5ac4341a90ecf135884d8ca71bdbd5d252

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
The COMPRESS_LOSSLESS and COMPRESS_LOSSY GDSTs are (or are rendered as) black rectangles.

Reverting to d801ff2b3db2de105c1b36a74ce116e360143d4e fixes the issue.

data.title: 2.1.3 stuttering problem and solution
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8.1 , Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
Even in the simplest of projects, I experienced stuttering.
So I played with the vsync setting in project settings, and found out that if I keep the leftmost checkbox ticked and the right one unticked, the stuttering disappears. No other combination works. 
Also tested it in another really simple project, where I had the same problem, and it works.

**Steps to reproduce:**
I don't really know. This existed before tinkering with the vsync settings.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[KidsCanCodeAlien.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1009061/KidsCanCodeAlien.zip)

data.title: Tab key can't be used in editor shortcuts.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux - Master

**Issue description:**
When pressing an Editor shortcut that involves the `Tab` key, Godot will focus the next `control` instead of activating the shortcut. Easily testable with the default "next/prev scene" shortcut.


**Steps to reproduce:**
- Have 2 or more scenes open.
- Press `ctrl + tab` or `ctrl + shift + tab`
- ...
- Don't Profit :(

data.title: Add extended check option to GDFunctionState::is_valid()
data.body: Whilst it may be good that the current implementation does the check only in debug builds, I think you should be able to check by hand if you are giving `GDFunctionState`s a long life span.

data.title: Add extended check option to GDFunctionState::is_valid() (2.1)
data.body: Whilst it may be good that the current implementation does the check only in debug builds, I think you should be able to check by hand if you are giving `GDFunctionState`s a long life span.
